name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 2-Amino-pyridine base (pyridine itself has a melting point around 106°C) with a methyl group attached, which reduces the melting point due to the reduced crystal lattice stability, estimated at around -10°C. The naphthalene ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced crystal lattice stability, estimated at around -10°C.
